title: Tim Grant (rugby league)
text:
Tim Grant (born 17 February 1988) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a . 
He previously played for the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> in two separate spells, and the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> and the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. Grant has played for <a href="City%20New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">City Origin</a>, <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in the <a href="2012%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">State of Origin series</a> and the <a href="All%20Stars%20Match">NRL All Stars</a>.
Background.
Grant was born in <a href="Penrith%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Penrith, New South Wales</a>, Australia.
Playing career.
Grant started his NRL career in 2007. He made his representative début for the <a href="City%20New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">City New South Wales team</a> in the 2011 <a href="City%20vs%20Country%20Origin">City vs Country Origin</a> match.
Grant was selected to make his début for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales Blues</a> in the <a href="2012%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">2012 State of Origin series</a>' second game. He took the first hit-up of the match and was seen as contributing well to the Blues's victory.
Early in the <a href="2014%20NRL%20season">2014 NRL season</a> Grant was relegated to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> and was informed by Penrith to find a new club, despite having two years left on his contract. Although the club later changed its tune, Grant finalised a move to the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in April 2014, signing a 4-year contract.
On 8 January 2016, Grant signed a 2-year contract with the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> starting effective immediately, after being granted a release from the final 3 years of his South Sydney contract.
At the end of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a>, Grant was released by Wests. Grant then signed a contract to return to his former club Penrith for the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a>. In Round 12 2019 against Manly-Warringah, Grant was taken from the field with an injury which was later revealed to be a torn pectoral muscle and was ruled out for the season. On 5 June 2019, Grant informed the Penrith club of his decision to terminate his contract.
On 14 November 2019, it was announced that Grant had signed a contract to join the Thirroul Butchers in the local Illawarra competition for 2020.
